alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 4:32PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, northern Marshall, Rutherford, eastern Maury, eastern Williamson, southern Wilson and northern Bedford Counties through 515 PM CST... At 431 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Franklin to Columbia. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Franklin, Columbia, Shelbyville, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Spring Hill, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Thompson`s Station, Watertown, Walterhill, Rural Hill, Antioch, Chapel Hill, Wartrace, Eagleville and Bell Buckle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for Middle Tennessee.
